{"step_by_step_thinking": "Phosphate bonded investment is a type of material used in the casting process. It is important for this material to be completely carbon free because carbon can have negative effects on the casting. Carbon can react with the molten metal and cause the investment to chip off when the metal enters the mold space. Additionally, carbon can also result in black castings. However, carbon does not make the casting brittle or result in a smooth casting.", "answer_choice": "A"}
